trigger_event: With Council records and BCI abuses exposed, public fury mounts. Nikola Petrak discovers he alone holds the authority to decide who should guide Stenograd’s next chapter: the people themselves, or Halden’s AI.
dilemma: Nikola must choose whether to hand governing power to emergent neighborhood assemblies—empowering public tribunals against the Council—or reactivate Halden’s AI persona, letting an algorithmic conscience lead the city through its greatest crisis.
reason: Nikola knows both paths bring danger: popular assemblies could spiral into chaos or vengeance, while the AI might mean another age of cold calculations. Haunted by recent confessions and uncertain of public trust, he doubts any single actor—human or machine—can carry this burden alone.
choice_a: Empower the neighborhood assemblies, authorizing public tribunals and full transfer of authority to citizen hands.
belief_a: Human judgment is essential to true accountability.
Social healing requires open truth, not digital mediation.
Power must be shared, not hoarded by systems.
choice_b: Reactivate Halden’s AI persona, granting it citywide access to guide citizens with daily advice and oversight.
belief_b: Algorithms offer impartiality, reducing risk of mob violence.
A guiding mind—however artificial—prevents societal collapse.
Order and stability matter more than purist ideals of justice.
